Name: ItemCode
Description: A Classification Item is identified by an alphabetical, numerical or alphanumerical code, which is in line with the code structure of the Level. The code is unique within the Statistical Classification to which the Classification Item belongs.

Name: DefiningConceptReference
Description: A concept which describes the Classification Item.

Name: Includes
Description: Specifies the contents of the category.

Name: IncludesAlso
Description: A list of borderline cases, which belong to the described category.

Name: Excludes
Description: A list of borderline cases, which do not belong to the described category. Excluded cases may contain a reference to the Classification Items to which the excluded cases belong.

Name: ExcludedClassificationItem
Description: A reference to the Classification Items to which the excluded cases belong.

Name: LevelNumber
Description: The number of the Level to which the Classification Item belongs.

Name: LevelReference
Description: The Level to which the Classification Item belongs.

Name: IsGenerated
Description: Indicates whether or not the Classification Item has been generated to make the Level to which it belongs complete.

Name: IsValid
Description: If updates are allowed in the Statistical Classification, a Classification Item may be restricted in its validity, i.e. it may become valid or invalid after the Statistical Classification has been released. Indicates whether or not the Classification Item is currently valid.

Name: ValidFrom
Description: Date from which the Classification Item became valid. The date must be defined if the Classification Item belongs to a floating Statistical Classification.

Name: ValidTo
Description: Date at which the Classification Item became invalid. The date must be defined if the Classification Item belongs to a floating Statistical Classification and is no longer valid.

Name: FutureEvents
Description: The future events describe a change (or a number of changes) related to an invalid Classification Item. These changes may e.g. have turned the now invalid Classification Item into one or several successor Classification Items. In describing these changes, terminology from the Typology of item changes, found in Appendix 3 should be used. This allows the possibility to follow successors of the Classification Item in the future.

Name: SuccessorClassificationItem
Description: Future events may e.g. have turned the now invalid Classification Item into one or several successor Classification Items, listed here

Name: ChangesFromPriorVersion
Description: Describes the changes, which the Classification Item has been subject to from the previous version to the actual Statistical Classification. In describing these changes, terminology from the Typology of item changes, found in Appendix 3 of GSIM should be used.

Name: Updates
Description: Describes the changes, which the Classification Item has been subject to during the life time of the actual Statistical Classification.

Name: ParentClassificationItem
Description: The Classification Item at the next higher Level of the Statistical Classification of which the actual Classification Item is a sub item.

Name: CaseLaws
Description: Refers to one or more case law rulings related to the Classification Item.
